turns.content: On macos in hdiutil what are the -srcimagekey, -tgtimagekey and -cacert options, give code example too

`hdiutil` is a command-line utility on macOS for working with disk images (`.dmg` files). The `-srcimagekey` and `-tgtimagekey` options are used for specifying the encryption algorithm and password for encrypting or decrypting a disk image.

`-srcimagekey` specifies the encryption algorithm and password for the source image.
`-tgtimagekey` specifies the encryption algorithm and password for the target image

For example, to encrypt a disk image named "mydisk.dmg" using the AES-256 encryption algorithm and a password of "secret", you would use the following command:
```
hdiutil convert -format UDRW -encryption AES-256 -srcimagekey password=secret -tgtimagekey password=secret -o myencrypteddisk.dmg mydisk.dmg
```
`-cacert` option is used to specify the path to a file containing one or more CA certificates to use when creating a signed disk image. It can be used to specify a certificate to sign the image with.
```
hdiutil create -srcfolder myfolder -format UDBZ -cacert myCAcert.pem -o mySignedDisk.dmg
```
Please note that the examples here are just for illustrative purpose and may not work as-is.
what is the difference with -cacert and -certificate option in hdiutil

The `-cacert` option in `hdiutil` is used to specify the path to a file containing one or more CA (Certificate Authority) certificates to use when creating a signed disk image. It can be used to specify the root CA certificate that the image should be signed with.

The `-certificate` option is used to specify the path to a file containing a certificate that is used to sign the disk image. This certificate must be signed by one of the CA certificates specified with the `-cacert` option.

In summary, `-cacert` option specifies the root CA certificate that the image should be signed with, while `-certificate` option is used to specify the certificate that is used to sign the disk image, which should be signed by one of the CA certificates specified with the `-cacert` option.

Here is an example of how to use both options together:
```
hdiutil create -srcfolder myfolder -format UDBZ -cacert myCAcert.pem -certificate myCert.pem -o mySignedDisk.dmg
```
This will use the myCAcert.pem as the root certifcate and myCert.pem as the certificate used to sign the disk image.
